subject: RE: [junit] Correct Use of assertEquals()
msgSnippet: ... Something like (don t forget hashCode or you may break any collection classes that use hashing if you insert one of these): public class
messageBody:
--- Luis Beaumier <lrb3000@...> wrote:
>How do I set up option number two, if I have multiple
>strings within my object?

Something like (don't forget hashCode or you may break any collection
classes that use hashing if you insert one of these):

public class MultipleInstanceVariables {
private String aString;
private int anInt;
private Object anObject; // assumes the Object has a good equals()

public boolean equals(Object other) {
if (this == other) return true;
if (other == null) return false;
if (other.getClass() != this.getClass()) return false;
MultipleInstanceVariables otherMIV = (MultipleInstanceVariables)
other;
if (!otherMIV.aString.equals(this.aString)) return false;
if (otherMIV.anInt != this.anInt) return false;
if (!otherMIV.anObject.equals(this.anObject)) return false;
return true;
}

public int hashCode() {
int code = anInt;
code ^= aString.hashCode();
code ^= anObject.hashCode();
return code;
}
}

Regards,

Rob
